abstract.t: This document defines an RFC3986 URI compliant identifier called a Labeled Segment URI in which name segments carry a label. This allows differentiation between unrelated resources with similar identifiers. A URI scheme that specifies the use of labeled segment URIs conforms to the encoding rules presented here. This document also describes Labeled Content Information - a labeled segment URI (LS-URI) representation of network data. This scheme, called "lci:", is applicable to network protocols such as Content Centric networks (CCN). Labeled Content Information applies specific labels to each name segment of a URI to disambiguate between resources with similar names. This document defines a specific set of segment labels with label semantics.
